Remain calm and be alert and awake, listen to warnings of heavy and prolonged period of rainfall from weather station, if your home is located below a debris covered area move away to safer place, listen to sounds of rock fall, moving debris and cracking of trees, or cracks in ground or any movement. Keep a battery operated ready for the night.
\nCall and help rescue teams, keep drinking water containers, first aid kit and essential medicines and avoid entering damaged houses.
\nWatch for flooding if close to river, help others who need help especially elderly people, children and women, seek advice from local authorities for rebuilding damaged houses, roads etc.
\nReport any damage of roads, power and telephone lines to concerned authorities.
